description.narrative: Ambassaden avser att använda ett revisionsföretag för att bedöma en organisation (Ipas Zambia) som vi kommer att ingå ett treårsavtal med, till ett värde av cirka 28 000 000 kronor. Ambassaden har aldrig tidigare arbetat med Ipas Zambia och har därför för avsikt att bedöma organisationens interna styrning och kontroll. Bedömningen förväntas identifiera (alternativt utesluta) eventuella svagheter. Baserat på resultaten så kommer Sida att kräva att Ipas behandlar svagheterna på lämpligt sätt före eller under avtalsfasen. Några av åtgärderna kommer även att ingå som del av avtalsvillkoren, vilka kommer att följas upp under den årliga revisionen.

The Embassy intends to use an audit firm to assess an organisation which we are entering into a 3 year agreement with, Ipas Zambia, worth approximately SEK 28,000,000. The Embassy has not previously worked with Ipas Zambia before and therefore intends to assess the organisation's financial management and internal controls. The assessment is expected to identify or exclude any eventual weaknesses. Based on the findings, Sida will require that Ipas addresses the weaknesses as appropriate before or during the agreement phase. Some of the measures will be included as agreement conditions to be followed up during the annual audit.

Some of the measures will be included as agreement conditions to be followed up during the annual audit.

description.narrative: The audit was completed and a report submitted as agreed. The Terms of reference were fully addressed.The results of audit placed a priority on Ipas Zambia to: Pursue other forms of finance and fundraising to ensure funding diversification and sustainability. It should also take immediate steps to address the risks of going concern from a financial statement perspective. These risks include a net deficiency in equity and an excess of current liabilities over current assets as 30 June 2017; Establish a Board of Directors to ensure compliance with its Constitution and amend the Constitution to state its mandate; Amend its practices to incorporate new risks into the risk register and to make anti-corruption practices available to third partners; and Consider including the budgeting module during the implementation stage of its new accounting system in 2018.
